website_summaries.verdict: A good set of pannier bags for touring on a bike for long distances and periods at a time.
pros: Set comes with 3 separate bags that can hold a number of clothes, small items and supplies
Top bag is designed to fit over the bike rack for better stability for larger items that may try to tip over
cons: Parts of the bag may scrape against the shoe on shorter bikes that lack the clearance between the pedals

customer_reviews.title: So much room!
customer_reviews.text: I love the 3 in 1 bags! I use my bike to commute to work on good days, and I do not like backpacks carrying the heavy bike locks and all my work gear. This was the perfect solution. It easily comes off so that all my stuff can go in to work with me, but it is secure on my bike while I am riding. It has so much room to carry everything I need and I love how sturdy it feels. I have not had an opportunity to test how water resistant it is, mostly because I dislike riding in the rain, but I am not worried at all. Overall very pleased and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: OtakusChaosTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: The bags have zero rigidness. Whatever you out in ...
customer_reviews.text: The bags have zero rigidness. Whatever you out in them is going to move and shift and if you're really unlucky will end up in your rear wheel spokes. I'm lucky I didn't crash. Now I have huge holes in my bags. Not worth it. Buy something with a hard inside wall.
customer_reviews.author: kolby lanham

customer_reviews.title: I bought this bag because it seemed like a cheap alternative to other panniers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag because it seemed like a cheap alternative to other panniers. The saddle bags are definitely cheap. I’ve used this 4 days a week commuting for the past month and already the bag is fraying because it hits the spokes or tires, even though I’ve installed it properly and keep it evenly weighted. This week one of the clips to secure it to my seat post cracked and is useless. The only good thing I learned from using this bag is that panniers are superior to a backpack. If anyone is looking for panniers, I would find a different product if you plan on using these often.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great pack with one problem...
customer_reviews.text: It does have good capacity. I like the design, and the separate top bag is a nice addition. Only thing is that when pedaling, the back end of my shoe does scrape the edge of the bag, unless I make a specific effort to place my feet towards the front of the pedal.I will learn to manage my feet so as to use the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Direxpo

customer_reviews.title: when done right you can fit alot in here
customer_reviews.text: glade to have purchased this for my Schwinn boundary you can fit tons of items in here when done right . I was able to fit 1 bomber jacket 1 pair of work pants 1 sleveless hoodie all in the top rear compartment i was abel to fit 2 bike inner tubes and a pair of gloves in the small left compartment the right compartment dedicated to gaterade power chews and beef jerky and one other compartment for survival gear such a binocoluers . you need a rear bike rack to install it and two valcro strapes to put on the sides of your bike . all in all i do recomend this bike bag.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great value, bags themselves are sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great value, bags themselves are sturdy. One zipper did break almost immediately which was a big dissapointment. Also can slide too easily to one side or the other - wish they had designed in a way to laterally stabilize better. But bang for buck, I'm happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: n/a

customer_reviews.title: Good value & features, is NOT waterproof. Fits well on a Rambo Bikes R150 "Extra Large Rack" [Rear]
customer_reviews.text: This "Roswheel 14892 3 in 1 Multifuction Bicycle Expedition Touring Cam Pannier" in Black or Army Green, is a nice, well made, value priced, and thoughtfully designed Pannier trunk bag. We put our lock cables, U-Lock, and bike water bottles in the rear pannier. It fit well on a 19"L x 7"W Rambo R150 "Extra Large Rack" [Rear] also available on Amazon. While sturdy, durable and well designed, it can't compare with waterproof pannier bag sets costing three times as much - so set your expectations accordingly. This is a great bag set for the recreational cyclist, but probably not for the daily commuter in rainy weather areas.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatic

customer_reviews.title: I do wish there was an extra strap or other attachments that would work better for my rack
customer_reviews.text: These bags can fit a lot of gear. I brought it on a trip to go camping. I was able to pack my tent and everything else I need with these bags. The only exception were cold items kept in my cooler. I do wish there was an extra strap or other attachments that would work better for my rack, however it still worked out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Parent of 4

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the price! Amazing storage! The best bags you will find for your bike in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Its okay but....
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It fits my rack, it is water RESISTANT, it can take up to two minutes taking it off and putting it on( pro and con), strong material, more or less good space. Cons: top bag falls to one side full or empty, strap is limited in length, strap for the side bags when you pull up turns into a duffle bag which I personally do not like since the strap is small, no instructions for instillation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great babe for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money these are great panniers. They could use a little bit better lower mounting system, as the Velcro came undone a man a few times. Also, the top bag doesn’t fit to securely until you fill it. If you have just a few things in it, it flops around from side to side as the top strap isn’t small enough to keep it secure to the side bags. But when it’s full of rocks pretty well. Overall though, for the money, great bag with lots of storage options.
customer_reviews.author: the chef

customer_reviews.title: Few things, but good overall
customer_reviews.text: Straps didn't exactly fit perfectly at first on my Ibera Universal Rack, but you'll get it right if you buckle in the right places. It says waterproof when I bought it and the material feels/ looks decent but I'm not sure how it'll do in the rain? We'll see I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton

customer_reviews.title: no backpack needed
customer_reviews.text: these look great and work really well to carry all my stuff, rain gear, lock chain, work stuff and everything else I could ever need. I love the ability to remove the top bag and carry in to work. I am disappointed with the water resistance . in the first drizzle of rain you could see the water going into the fabric, however the inside of the bag did stay dry. the next time I just detached the entire set and took it inside to avoid any issues. they are very easy to install and look and work great on my sondors X
customer_reviews.author: Leif H.

customer_reviews.title: A Keeper
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive at first about shelling out $40 for this pannier combo, but it was worth it. Just having it sure takes a big, aching load off my back. I wish I'd bought it sooner. I was deciding between this and a traditional basket for my rear bike rack. I went with this because my groceries won't fall out like it could in an open-top basket, and I can also ride in the rain with it just in case I was unlucky enough to get caught in a downpour.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Ray

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Bags
customer_reviews.text: It looks bigger than it is but it's very well constructed and has more than enough room for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Woody1

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly small bags, but well built.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointingly small bags. The photos make them look a lot larger. I stopped by Walgreen's and bought 4 nongshim ramen noodles bowls which filled one side to capacity. I seriously doubt even with two trips these could carry a full weeks groceries for me. The build seems ok which is why I did not give them a one star. For a recreational rider, or someone with light needs these would be great bags. For a car free person like myself they are almost worthless. For me, it's back to dutch style bags.
customer_reviews.author: harshbarj

customer_reviews.title: Great storage
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are perfect for my bike. My bike is My main transportation so I have been looking for something that was practical and had decent storage. Nailed it. I love that the top storage bag is removable. I pack my stuff for work so it's easy to just remove the bag and carry it with me and vice versa when I return from work. It's amazing what you can fit in this if you know how to pack. I make all my trips to the grocery store...no problem
customer_reviews.author: Maureen O'quinn

customer_reviews.title: They delivered. Quality and flexibility at a great price
customer_reviews.text: After perusing Amazon, comparing reviews..I settled on the Roswheel 14892 3 in 1 Multifuction Bicycle Expedition Touring Cam Pannier for my first pannier experiment. My maiden voyage included a typical, heavy, tropical, Florida downpour for 30 minutes on my return route. The panniers delivered on their water resistant claim. I had items from the market and a towel stowed away and all were safe, sound and dry upon arrival home. The panniers are well made and I used the convenient "detachable top bag" as a tote at the market. I will purchase another!!
customer_reviews.author: Lightning Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Just a great pannier.
customer_reviews.text: This Roswheel pannier bag is the absolute best and fits my Himiway ebike like it was built for it. It has tons of storage and it doesn’t hit you’re heel while peddling. Enough room for charger, tools, clothing change, jackets, and it looks great on my bike. It’s constructed of canvas so I carry a plastic sheet for a downpour. Loads of zippers. I would highly recommend this bag
customer_reviews.author: A. Provenz

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: This bag can be packed with a lot of item. i put this bag to the test by going shopping for food. i was able to pack this bag with groceries and could have packed more. I had a 5 mile ride with these bags packed and did not have any issues with them. In one of my photos you can see all the groceries i packed in the bag. i would recommend this bag set for anyone looking to had some decent cargo for their bike.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Donald

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: I put this bag on my catrike also my wife’s ( I got two) the bags are nicely made lots of room and fit nicely on my bike rake. Can’t wait to put my stuff in them that I need for a ride. Two nice large nets to hold extra water. The top bag is great if you need to put important things in and remove to take with you. It says water resistant but I’m going to spray to make water proof. Side bags are large and have great support to them. I would definitely buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: That what you think it is!
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of trash the top bag when you fill it up flip flop around you unzip the side bag it wants to fall off and there is no way to tighten it up but panner bags work just fine there's not enough room there not enough room you put anything in there I wasted too much money I don't just want to do what I want so there's a piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... them full quite yet but the quality seems very good. They are smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to pack them full quite yet but the quality seems very good. They are smaller than I expected, for reference you can fit a box of wine in one side pouch and that's about it. The fact that you get two side panniers along with the top bag makes it a great value. Attaching the bags to my rack is easy, simple snap clips, and seems very secure when riding. No issues with feet rubbing the bags while peddling. Very pleased, just wish they were a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great space, durable.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now and it has worked well for my purposes, going to and from work and school, this bag helps, excellent storage space and with a little ingenuity, you can snap-on extra bags using metal loops or ties to expand the storage space. The zippers are a little fragile but in daily use they are adequate. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof. I would say water resistant. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof. I would say water resistant. I was caught it in the rain with items in the saddlebags, and every items had water on them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Portman

customer_reviews.title: Good bags, but please read
customer_reviews.text: A good bag, thick Cordura type material with heavy zippers. About as water resistant as you'd expect heavy heavy nylon material to be. Very very good carry capacity, great design except... And there's two schools of thought on this..... Not the quickest bags to set up or remove. If you want fat removal, or mounting straps designed for many removal cycles, nope. But then again, maybe that's a good thing. If they were to easy to pop off the bike, well.... I think we'll of them, bought two now for myself and my old lady. Much better carry capacity than most of the saddle bags you'll see, satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Todd CornelisonSNT

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty ONLY!
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag about once a week for 2 months, and several spots are already tearing. This is especially noticeable on the small handle on the top bag, which I only used for a 3" ring binder. I suppose if you're only looking to carry clothes, towels, etc. then it'll get the job done, but after less than 60 days of carrying a few binders, folders, and 2 books, I've got tears that I'm going to need to repair myself before the whole thing comes apart. The only place I can see giving it fair marks is water resistance, and mine only got wet once, so take that with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa J

customer_reviews.title: The size of each bag is perfect, the material seems durable
customer_reviews.text: I used them for a one month, 2,000 km cycle tour, from Vancouver to San Francisco and they were enough, I didnt need front bags. The size of each bag is perfect, the material seems durable, and the price is really good. I would only change the straps that attaches the upper bag to the side bags for ones that are adjustable. It's water resistant, not waterproof, but it kept my things dry when we had a light rain. Totally recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and it is missing a buckle. The top bag attaches to the bottom by four buckles, but one is missing from the bottom bags. Replacement will take four weeks? Rediculous.
customer_reviews.author: Kirby

customer_reviews.title: OK, but NOT Great
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Price point, look, and size of storage. Con: Durability shows the cheapness of the product. The backing used in the side pouches did not keep their shape, curling, and then getting caught in the wheel. Not at all water resistant, as items were wet from a light sprinkle. Bottom Line: Not the worst product for the price, but if you have a great support on your back wheel, and you are willing to take a risk on the product...
customer_reviews.author: Mattchew

customer_reviews.title: if you need junk in the trunk
customer_reviews.text: Have used mine bike camping several times now. Worked great. Easy to toss on and off the bike. (You WILL NEED a rear rack, sold separately) Was able to stuff extra comfy accessories into the saddlebags. Held up well, did NOT tear, rip, fall off, or cause regret on any of my trips. The corners do tent to be attracted toward the spokes, so be, mindful and bend em the other way if they start to rub.
customer_reviews.author: George Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag to match & fit my Axiom Fatliner Bike Rack on my Fat Bike and it's just what I was looking for. I used this bag for doing my laundry and groceries and it works fine. I love all the snap-on little buckles on it & the Velcro straps at the bottom that makes the fitting perfect with my rack. If u wonder about space, it's enough. Unless you are doing touring, but still you could have a light touring packing.
customer_reviews.author: N. Callado

customer_reviews.title: Great bag to twist into your wheel and chance a wreck!
customer_reviews.text: The bag is flimsy and doesn't have any hard parts to speak of, which means it's a matter of time before it starts to wear and stretch, twists around into your spokes, and makes you wreck on the street. Thankfully this time the only casualty was my phone, but take my word for it, the thing is a safety hazard. Don't put anything valuable in a Roswheel bag. Don't put yourself on a bicycle that has one.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: These are not the big, big tour bags you see on tv-these are a little smaller.
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this bag!!! It's been very durable-perfect for weekenders and commuting. You do need to weight both sides evenly or it'll pull to one side but secures on the rack front and back and the top back has a removable strap so you can unclick it, (which is a breeze), and voila! You have everything you need for work or going in to a restaurant!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transport my laptop computer and camera bag conveniently without wearing a backpack or strapping it down with twine and bungees. Although my camera bag was a snug fit on one side, I struggled with my 15 inch computer. The laptop does fit in the top bag, only the straps that attach the top bag to the saddle are not adjustable. Meaning, the thing moves around freely and can be lifted a foot above the saddle (while strapped)! It will fall to one side without jury rigging- which brings me back to where I was without the pannier. Not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Kacey L.

customer_reviews.title: These bags are awesome and very durable
customer_reviews.text: These bags are awesome and very durable. They worked great for a bike camping trip i took and for every time i go to the supermarket. They have plenty of straps to secure them and would take someone substantial time to steal them, so i expect have them for quite some time. I also added Zip Ties that would need to be cut off to slow the process even further.
customer_reviews.author: Darkpassenger

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for commuting.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my gyms shoes and clothing in one side and my lunch for work on the other side. Also has auxiliary pockets for tools and what not. I have yet to use the bag that fits on top. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a bike bag.
customer_reviews.text: It is nice and big. I believe I took everything but the kitchen sink, but there was room. (smile) Nice size for a bike bag. I put an insulated cooler with my frozen water bottles in the top compartment along with snacks. And I still had room left over. The side bags...a set of clothes in each bag, my bicycle repair kit and my tire repair kit with tube for flats. And I had plenty of room left over. I had about 10 pounds of stuff between the two side bags. Great bag!
customer_reviews.author: Shortcake

customer_reviews.title: Spacious
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to use as a saddlebag on my ebike. I wanted a bag to carry an extra battery without having the weight imbalanced on the sides. I like the way the top middle bag can be used or not. The battery fits the middle bag and secures to the side bags securely. I have been looking for something like this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Just like the old days, on my horse with the saddle bag carrying the coffee,
customer_reviews.text: I use it with an ebike and for the money they are the best. I carry my water jug, battery charger, rain coat, wallet, keys, and everything else. They fit perfect on my beach cruiser ebike and are very, very handy if you ride bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Can you sew?
customer_reviews.text: Love the bags, but the construction on the seams is a bit lacking... Both sides of my main compartment side bags ripped holes out at the bottom seems. I inverted the bag, seam ripped off the edging, ran it through my serger, replaced the edging and did a couple rows of stitching through it all. No rips since.
customer_reviews.author: C Glass

customer_reviews.title: Smaller pannier that is just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The cutout for pedaling is a big boon for these panniers--makes them fit perfectly my short wheelbase commuter/errand runner. Sensible and effective connections to a rack makes them easy to take off and on. Haven't used them in rain so can't comment, but highly recommend these lightweight panniers for those who haul smaller loads.
customer_reviews.author: Soda

customer_reviews.title: They look and feel good.
customer_reviews.text: I only went 4 stars because the zippers don't appear to be very heavy duty. Other than that they look well made. I like how they fit on my bike. I'm not sure on the back straps because they seemed like there was a lot of strap left over so I crossed them before buckling and that fixed it. I'll revisit this review after my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husbands birthday. Lots of storage space, including a spot for a water bottle. Has velcro to keep it secured to the rack and my hubs loves it. So much storage for shopping or if you’re a delivery person!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great basic gear.
customer_reviews.text: Great low end gear for a recreational biker. Use it for trips to the grocers, gym, etc. Easy on/off of top bag is a plus. Haven’t used it in rain, but I doubt it has any water repellent properties. Easy adjustments and good quality for a product at this low price point.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great bags.
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. Plenty of room. Top bag pops off easily. They took 5 min to put on the rack that I Installed the other day. 29in mountain bike trek
customer_reviews.author: I. Felix

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: My only worry was the stitching, but it seems good. I hit mine with some Scotch Guard, just to give it a little extra rain protection. However the front pouch on top is mesh so just make sure not to use that one for anything that can't get wet. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Wolfman

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: These bages are very nice and well made. Several compartments and will hold lots of stuffand are so versatile, Im very happy with my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: J Nelson

customer_reviews.title: compact, and seems to hold a lot - not a fan of the branding, but like the color options
customer_reviews.text: Seems okay - wish the branding was a bit more subtle, i will likely try to use goof-off or acetone to remove the large branding on the sides but it seems like a well made item. I will update this review as time goes on as to how it holds up on my 20" fatbike.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: Although its a has nice storage and convenient, it is not waterproof. I bought this mainly because it supposed to be waterproof and its not, I’m disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Omar Zapata

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday bags
customer_reviews.text: Love these bags, they take a minute or two to attach, but are really easy to either carry the while set or just the top bag. I haven't tested water resistance, I have rain bags with actual water covers which always leak some through, so I'm sure my stuff would get pretty wet in these with anything but a light misting. Plus I don't want to get them dirty. Overall bags have great space, very flexible, would buy again. I wouldn't rely on there in heavy rain or if you worry about protecting delicates during a crash though.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan F.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a 100 mile plus bike trip and was big enough to hold three days worth of clothes, raincoat and a small pillow. Held up well. Did fine in a light rain. Clothes were dry. I think it was worth the money and I am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag! Plenty of storage water resistant only
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of storage was what I needed for work and it delivered! Water resistance is not water proof and I was aware. It serves its purpose for the short time its exposed to rainy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Take it easy on the zippers, bags are great
customer_reviews.text: Used for a 7 day impromtu bikepacking trip on the Katy Trail in Missouri. Worked awesome. They hold so much is throws off the handling of the bike. Would do again. Zippers are flimsy and not YKK, but that's about it the most "you get what you pay for" part of these.
customer_reviews.author: Soyland

customer_reviews.title: Not Awful. Not for Daily Use
customer_reviews.text: Not bad bags. The top bag is very convenient. I need the bags for daily use and frequent access. They do not hold up. If you do the occaissional overnight, then these are probably fine. If you need heavy duty use and reliability, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: george christovich

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Plenty of space
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Plenty of space. No real complaints. My bike has 20" wheels, and I have to be careful to affix it far back enough or I can hit it with my heels when pedaling, but if one is careful this is avoidable. If anything, the backing on the side bags could be sturdier, but overall does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Tony D

customer_reviews.title: Big, Versatile Bags
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of space for laptop, u-lock/chain, change of clothes, extra lights, pump, and food. I like that the top bag has a carrying strap so you can easily take it with you.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: Better than a back pack
customer_reviews.text: I took my bike onto the ferry going to Victoria vancouver island and left the car in the states. Saddlebags worked well. Had to use zip ties to keep my pedals from scraping. The volume /storage was adequate for the trip but if you are doing any camping i might go with a larger capacity as a tent and sleeping bag will not fit. All in all a great fit for just transporting bare necessities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for these were an inexpensive option but the material definitely feels cheap and I definitely​ see their replacement in the near future. Decent size large enough to carry my needs during m commute.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Great universal saddle bags for your rack
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day for school. Great universal saddle bags for your rack. Oddly shaped, wished the interior were more tailored to a standard text book on the sides. The angles make water bottles sit funny and the strap/clip system doesn't really work well with my pannier system but I was able to rig it together. Can't beat the price though, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Eunos96

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Just got it a week ago used once on my old trek 800, worked for our needs, small children and a 10 mile bike ride on sunset trail in peninsula state park door county WI, I carried all the water, snacks, first aid and tool kit, if the top bag it not completely full its flops around as side buckles are not adjustable...it deatches easily though and makes for an easy carry shower bag at campground...
customer_reviews.author: Shane P

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I really was surprised when I first went to the grocery store and tested the capacity of this product. It exceeded expectations! Quality is first rate. Haven't had a chance to test water resistance, but I don't usually ride in the rain anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Johnha7

customer_reviews.title: Short lived, suitable only for light use.
customer_reviews.text: When loaded, these have a propensity to list to one side or the other, sometimes nearly to the point of falling off, always with the effect of shifting the weight. It's only been a couple months of mostly grocery runs and a zipper and clip are broken. I've avoided using the top bag due to the listing problem mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: Petra Jonte

customer_reviews.title: What a Bargain!!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, well made and attractive. I would definitely suggest these inexpensive bike bags for your E-bikes. Looks much more expensive than what I paid. Better than the bike bags from the Pedego dealer actually!!
customer_reviews.author: Sumsand4mom

customer_reviews.title: Good for going to the grocery store etc.
customer_reviews.text: It is well made for the price. The first one I received had a defective zipper but it was exchanged with no hassle. I don’t know if it’s waterproof as I have not used it in rain.
customer_reviews.author: Wondering

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I liked the storage capacity of these bags and I certainly appreciated the pricetag, but they got torn up pretty easily and I often had to stop and adjust the load to keep the bags from catching on my spokes.
customer_reviews.author: Canton Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use for work (clothes) and groceries. I especially love the option to use the 3rd bag, and has a long handle incase I need to take it off and use as a "purse". I won't be using in wet weather so I don't know if it's water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Water resistant so much so I forgot to fold the flap over the zipper and in that case it will hold water. Also left it out this winter by mistake. Gently cleaned it and it’s like new
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m pleased with the size and look
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this product, and installed it on the bike. I’m pleased with the size and look. Lots of room to put jackets and grear. The reflective lettering on the side of the panners are a plus. They seem light for city rides, might want heavier panners for touring. Love the snap on bag on top, but there is a lot of space between the panner and top bag which you could put more gear like a tent or sleeping bag eat. Overall I’m happy with it. I have yet to road test it, looking forward to see how it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value. That the top bag is removable makes ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. That the top bag is removable makes the whole system very versatile. They go on and off in about two minutes and are very spacious bags.
customer_reviews.author: John Speier

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Received item on August 5th and the seams are coming apart already. Quality isn't all that good. Will be talking to the seller to resolve this issues 😤
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pannier bags
customer_reviews.text: Like the bags, we keep the helmets in them. Plenty of storage. I like the to bag because it can be detached as a carry bag. I use this pannier bag each time we take our cannondale quick cx bikes out for a ride and they do what we wanted in a pannier bags. Good job.
customer_reviews.author: ZZ

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this before a trip in the Great Allegheny Passage. Bag is all that I expected. Easy to put on. Nice that top compartment comes off easy. Has handles for easy carry. It didnt rain on our trip, so cant comment on that - but otherwise it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Decent set of bags although, they could have been slightly larger. I did attempt a rain repellent spray as I commute daily. Regardless, have found water inside so look for something else if you plan to travel in all weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: B-rent

customer_reviews.title: Durability and price
customer_reviews.text: The bags are big and durable. The price is phenominal and a great bargain. The bags strap securely to my bikes rack. I have a fatbike so I wasn’t sure if it was going to work but it fits perfectly. I’m planning to use these bags to keep the weight low on my bike while bikepacking.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Locke

customer_reviews.title: Good price, hold a lot
customer_reviews.text: Good price, hold a lot. I have some problem with the rear corners wanting to twist in and rub the spokes. I wish it had a piece of rigid plastic in there to stop that, but I'll try and add that myself. I installed on a fat tire bike so maybe that's why.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Hersman

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy item
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves it so much. He rides his bike to store and loads it up plus he can carry everything he needs for a long bike ride
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie  Hott

customer_reviews.title: Pannier
customer_reviews.text: I loved the pannier and it held up great through out our touring from Reno to San Francisco. I would have kept it rated it 5 star if it wasn’t for the strap keep getting loosen and hit my heel. I did fixed the issue by using a zip tie and completed the tour with no issue. The pannier have plenty of room that I didn’t need to use to top part. I hope they can fix that issue and might purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: JR.T

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy, made bike unbalnced
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy, weight goes all over the place, the Velcro straps kept coming apart. would not recommend for a long distance bikepacking trip
customer_reviews.author: John David Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Sold luggage at a great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: The detachable top shoulder bag is a nice plus. I was concerned about the stitching strength supporting heavy cargo, however I cycled a bumpy ride home with a gallon of milk in each saddle bag with no damage to the luggage. For the price it can’t be beat. I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bobya Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Gets caught in the wheel
customer_reviews.text: Affordable but didn’t last more than 6 months. The side bags have a piece of plastic to give it a stiff shape on the inner sides but this is too easily bent. As soon as this is compromised (usually by packed items), it frequently gets caught by wheel spokes and you’re coming to a quick halt in the middle of the road. I’m back on Amazon to buy a new pannier.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Helm

customer_reviews.title: Started falling apart after one bike ride
customer_reviews.text: After one bike ride, I noticed that the seams had started ripping. This was on a trial bike ride, and I only had my U lock, a set of screwdrivers, keys, phone, and water bottle in the bags. After reading the other one star reviews and noting that these bags can get into the wheel when they fall apart and cause crashes, I decided to return it and get something sturdier (and suggest that others do the same).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bike bag
customer_reviews.text: The size of the bag is about right.. and looks well made. I’ve only had it for a few days so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Just what I need
customer_reviews.text: Bag/s are perfect, fits my fat tire bike. love the easily detachable top bag, It's replaced my backpack. The option for padding for a laptop or tab would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy Carter

customer_reviews.title: Works well, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight of material, zippers are good quality. I'd like the detachable horizontal part a bit bigger to fit my extra large laptop, but it is an EXTRA large laptop. The clips for attachment work well. The velcro on the inside of to attach to the rack supports works well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Roehnelt

customer_reviews.title: Great looking bike bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a must if you like cruising the coast line. Plenty of room to pack your lunch and sweat shirts. We enjoy filling the bag with our purchases at the local shops.
customer_reviews.author: woodcutter457

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of stuff...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for small grocery shopping trips and had plenty of room. I Like It! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Paul N.

customer_reviews.title: Great bags multifunctional!
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome! I just also realized the top pack has straps to be used as a book bag...I unclip and walk away from my bike ready for work...no unpacking the essentials. Awesome stuff and price can’t be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, strong stitching.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, excellent stitching, right size and great price point. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about it . It can hold a lot of stuff. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano Palazzo

customer_reviews.title: Almost got it
customer_reviews.text: There is plenty of room to store what you need for your bike ride. What I disliked about the saddle bags the straps to secure it to the frame are inadequate. And they get caught in the spokes
customer_reviews.author: Steven Just Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m happy with this product. No complaints. Arrived on time and in perfect condition. Thanks a bunch!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: They are great bags,much bigger than I thought that would be. I would b in them again.
customer_reviews.author: douglas curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great bags
customer_reviews.text: Great storage capacity for the price, haven't used them in the rain yet. Only downside is the saddle bags on either side of the wheel sag inwards so had to rig it so they wouldn't rub against the spokes of the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: For the price, exceeds the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a 3 day bike tour, packed an A frame tent, sleeping bag, camp stove, bike gear, light change of clothes and toiletries. Top bag may shift a bit, used some small bungee cords to fix it. Great quality, great price compared with most pannier bags.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Solution is great, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Solution is great. Great quality. Super happy with purchase. Have a 20” tire foldable bike and it fits great
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Yarahuan

customer_reviews.title: does what it says
customer_reviews.text: i would give it 5 stars if the price were a bit lower or if it were waterproof but its a good piece of equipment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and roomy
customer_reviews.text: Like the product, seems well made. Not waterproof but works well and are well built
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wellington

customer_reviews.title: Great storage and durability.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for a bike camping trip. I utilized these bags as my primary bags. When I got to my destination it started raining, so I was nervous all my contents would be soaked but the bags held up fairly well. Bags are very versatile and have great storage.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, good size. I've just used the side bags not the top one but the are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Warren

product_meta.title: Roswheel 14892 3 in 1 Multifuction Bicycle Expedition Touring Cam Pannier
product_meta.description:
Roswheel 3 in 1 multifunction rack panniers is a good choice for commuting, camping, long journey riding, in town shopping or everyday school. 

 Features: 

 1. The bag is made of water resistant canvas material, solid and durable. 

 2. Unique 3-in-1 multifunction design. Two side bag are built together and the top is detachable. Detachable top bag can be used as a backup bag for extra space. It’s easy changed as a shoulder bag with included shoulder strap. 

 3. Easy Installation: using 3 buckles with adjustable straps and 2 Velcro straps to assemble or disassemble side bags to the rack. 4 buckles for top bag fixing. 

 4. Large volume capacity up to 37L (10 gallons). Top bag with a big mesh pocket can hold a 17 inches laptop. Each side bag has a big pocket and as small mesh pocket. It has enough room to carry cycling accessories cycling tools, every day grocery and camping gears. 

 5. Reflective handle and Logo on side for better safety for low light riding. 

 6. Built-in PE board to reduce shock and keep shape. 

 Specifications: 

 Color: Army Green 

 Capacity: 37L (10 gallons) 

 Materials: 1000D Polyester 

 Weight: 2.3 pounds
feature_bullets: Materials: 1000D reinforce polyester with PU coating, water resistant, solid and durable
Large capacity: The total volume up to 37L (about 10 gallons)
Angled bag design: angle design for two side bag ensures enough pedaling space
Safety: reflective handles, two side large reflective logos for better safety in low light

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
